Expectation1: Ensuring financial stability for the family
Situation1: A home loan repayment is due in two months, and the parent needs to prepare for it
Situation2: A heated dispute has escalated to the point where they are questioning staying together.
Story:
I sat at the kitchen table, my laptop open to the bank’s website, the numbers blurring together. The home loan repayment loomed over me, just two months away, and I knew I had to start setting aside every spare dollar. My mind raced with calculations—groceries, school fees, the electricity bill. I couldn’t let my family down; they depended on me to keep us afloat.

My phone buzzed with a message from Mia. “We need to talk. I can’t keep doing this if you won’t listen.” My heart clenched. Our argument last night still echoed in my head—her voice trembling, mine raised in frustration. She needed me to be present, to work through our problems, to show her that our relationship mattered. But every time I tried to focus on us, the weight of my family’s needs pulled me away.

I stared at the screen, torn. I wanted to call her, to fix things, but the thought of missing a payment made my chest tighten. I felt trapped between two worlds, each demanding more than I had to give.
